Michigan Historical Collections

titlepage.titleproper:
Finding aid for
Suomi College Finnish-American collection, 1880-1972
titlepage.author:
Finding aid created by
Keijo Virtanen (1975) and Kent Randell (2008 revisions)

did.langmaterial: The material is in Finnish, English, and Swedish
did.abstract: The Finnish Collection consists of 100 reels of microfilm concerning Finnish-American Churches, Labor Societies, Temperance Organizations, and other materials from the United States and Canada. The collection is the result of a joint project between the Bentley Library, Suomi College (now Finlandia University), and the University of Turku, Finland, coordinated in 1974-75.

repository.corpname: Bentley Historical Library, University of Michigan

acqinfo.p: The microfilm collection was received by arrangement with the college in 1975.

accruals.p: No further additions to the records are not expected.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open to research.

userestrict.p: Copyright is not held by the Regents of the University of Michigan. No copies of these materials can be sold to any institute or researcher in North America without the written permission of University of Turku, Finland, Michigan Historical Collections of the University of Michigan and Suomi College (now Finlandia University) in Hancock, Michigan.

prefercite.p: [item], folder, box, Suomi College Finnish-American collection, Bentley Historical Library, University of Michigan

bioghist.p: The Finnish Collection consists of 100 reels of microfilm concerning Finnish-American Churches, Labor Societies, Temperance Organizations, and other materials from the United States and Canada. The contents were filmed at the Suomi College (now Finlandia University) Historical Archive and are the result of a joint project between the Bentley Library, Suomi College (now Finlandia University), and the University of Turku, Finland, coordinated in 1974-75. Much of the fieldwork and cataloging of the Finnish Collection at the Bentley Historical Library, including the obtaining of materials, was performed by Keijo Virtanen, doctoral candidate at the University of Turku who held a Research Assistantship at the Michigan Historical Collections in 1974-1975.

scopecontent.p: The Suomi College Finnish-American Collection is comprised of 100 reels of microfilm containing records from 151 separate organizations (68 of which are located in Michigan). These organizations are comprised of the following kinds of records:

list.item: Church materials: 62 record groups (32 from Michigan)
Labor societies: 9 record groups (0 from Michigan)
Temperance materials: 61 record groups (26 from Michigan

scopecontent.p: Other organizations, including educational, relief, musical, athletic, national, historical societies, publishing companies, and some personal: 19 record groups (10 from Michigan)
Because the materials have been filmed in a random order, an index at the end of the container listing has been prepared to guide the researcher to specific kinds of records: church, temperance, etc.

odd.head: Subject Index to Microfilm
odd.p: This index was prepared from the original container listing. As the materials were microfilmed in a somewhat random order, this index intends to bring together church, temperance, labor, and other organizational records. In this index, the records are further listed alphabetically and then by place name.
